LEE CASENORKER OF KOWLOON DO NOT WRITE BELOW THE FOLLOWING LINE The consular officer will assist you in answering the following parts 34 and 35 , (I claim to be exempt from ineligibility to Ie- 34. ceive visa and exclusion under item in part 32 for the following reason:) nil 35. (I claim to be a) 6th preference quota immigrant) (under the China quota) (Norquota immigrant) (My claim is based on the following facts:) I claim status P6-1 under Section 203 a) (6) as a needed skilled or unskilled worker, and I am the beneficiary of an approved visa petition. I understand that I am required to surrender my visa to the United States Immigration Officer at the place where I apply to enter the United States, and that the possession of a visa does not entitle me to enter the United States if at that time I am found to be inadmissible under the immigration laws. understand that any willfully false or misleading statement or willful concealment of a material fact made by me herein may subject me to permanent exclusion from the United States and, if I am admitted to the United States, may subject me to criminal prosecution and/or deportation. in knowledge and belief. I do further swear (or affirm) that, if admitted into the United States, I will not engage in activities which this I, application have been made by me, including the encircling of items in part 32, and are true and complete to the best of my the undersigned applicant for a United States immigrant visa, do solemnly swear (or affirm) that all statements which appear would be prejudicial to the public interest, or endanger the welfare, safety, or security of the United States; in activities which would be prohibited by the laws of the United States relating to espionage, sabotage, public disorder, or in other activities subversive to the the national security; in any activity a purpose of which is the opposition to, or the control or overthrow of, the Government of organization which is registered or required to be registered under Section 7 of the Subversive Activities Control Act of 1950. United States, by force, violence, or other unconstitutional means; or join, affiliate with, or participate in the activities of any I understand all the foregoing statements, having asked for and obtained an explanation on every point which was not clear to me.
